page.title: 16PLACES TO GO NR.WIDEGATES
page.content: The Deer park is situated nearby in Hessenford.As it is privately owned,we have to ask the land owner Mr Spaulding for permission to use his grounds. Five different kinds of Deer roam around the 48 acres of wood land.They are the Red,Roe,Fallow, Black and Menel Deer. Another place of interest is the Dobwalls Forest Railway.This is a minature line run by steam engines.The engines are operational between April and September. The Monkey Sanctuary near Looe is a natural environment for the Woolly Monkey.Not confined to a cage they are allowed to roam free for the visitors to see.Information on the monkeys can be obtained on entrance to the Sanctuary.
